item.title: 1分で終わるエピソードを持つドラマを特集する中国資本のアプリ、ReelShortを紹介。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
A look at ReelShort, a Chinese-backed app featuring dramas with episodes that last a minute; its CEO says it has generated $22M in revenue since its 2022 launch  —  ReelShort aims to succeed where Quibi failed—with cheesy plots and supernatural elements packed into one-minute episodes

item.title: ライオンズゲート、ハズブロのeOneの買収を3億7500万ドルで完了。
item.description:
Jill Goldsmith / Deadline:
Lionsgate closes its acquisition of Hasbro's eOne for $375M plus assuming some production financing loans; Lionsgate's library grows by 6,500 film and TV titles  —  Lionsgate said today its acquisition of global entertainment platform eOne from Hasbro is done.

item.title: 調査：ソーシャルメディア企業は2022年、未成年者からの広告収入で合計～110億ドルを米国で稼いだ、YouTubeは12歳以下のユーザーから9億5,910万ドルを得て最も多かった（AP通信）。
item.description:
Associated Press:
Study: social media companies collectively made ~$11B in US ad revenue from minors in 2022; YouTube earned the most at $959.1M from users 12 and under  —  Social media companies collectively made over $11 billion in U.S. advertising revenue from minors last year, according to a study …

item.title: FCC、ラジオ・テレビ放送局の規制緩和要求を拒否、所有者が市場でコントロールできるテレビ・ラジオ局の数に関する規則を再確認（Al Tompkins/Poynter）
item.description:
Al Tompkins / Poynter:
The FCC rejects radio and TV broadcasters' call for deregulation, reaffirming rules on the number of TV or radio stations that owners can control in a market  —  The owners had argued for looser ownership restrictions given the growth of social media, podcasts and other online services.

item.title: ABCとNBCはNFLの試合のおかげで最も好調だったが、CBSとFOXの視聴率はそれぞれ前年同期比32％減、26％減だった（Rick Porter/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Rick Porter / The Hollywood Reporter:
Broadcast ratings sank in fall 2023 due to the strikes; ABC and NBC did best thanks to NFL games, CBS and Fox ratings fell 32% YoY and 26% YoY, respectively  —  Bright spots like ‘The Golden Bachelor’ and the NFL can't paper over a lost fall for the networks.

item.title: フランスのソルボンヌ大学が、非営利の学術データプロバイダーであるオープンアレックスに移行。
item.description:
Andrew Jack / Financial Times:
France's Sorbonne University switches to OpenAlex, a nonprofit academic data provider, boosting a growing movement to make research available for free  —  Paris university's ‘radical decision’ to join OpenAlex challenges for-profit providers  —  A leading French university has cancelled …

item.title: ポーランドの新政権が国営メディアの自由化に踏み切ったことで、2人の対立する公共テレビ局長が任命されるなど、政治戦争が勃発した（Bartosz Brzeziński/Politico）。
item.description:
Bartosz Brzeziński / Politico:
Poland's new government taking sweeping steps to free its state media sets off a political war, including the appointment of two dueling chiefs of public TV  —  WARSAW — Poland's new pro-EU government has taken sweeping steps to free state media from the political stranglehold imposed …

item.title: NYTがOpenAIとマイクロソフトを著作権侵害で提訴、AIの訓練に何百万もの記事が使われたと主張、米主要メディアで初の提訴（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
The NYT sues OpenAI and Microsoft for copyright infringement, alleging they used millions of its articles to train AI, the first major US media outlet to sue  —  Millions of articles from The New York Times were used to train chatbots that now compete with it, the lawsuit said.

item.title: バイデンの娘の日記が盗まれたとされる事件で、米判事がProject Veritasの憲法修正第1条の主張を却下。
item.description:
Larry Neumeister / Associated Press:
A US judge rejects Project Veritas' First Amendment claim in the case of an alleged theft of a diary of Biden's daughter; prosecutors may now get 900+ documents  —  Criminal prosecutors may soon get to see over 900 documents pertaining to the alleged theft of a diary belonging …

item.title: PwCによると、メディアとテレコムの取引件数と取引額は減少したが、アナリストは2024年にメディアとテレコム部門の統合が進むと予想している（Alexandra Canal/Yahoo Finance）
item.description:
Alexandra Canal / Yahoo Finance:
Analysts expect more consolidation in 2024 for the media and telecom sector, after a year in which PwC says media and telecom deal volume and values were down  —  Wall Street is ready for the next big media merger.  —  As companies in the space face challenges such as cord cutting …

item.title: 俳優の演技をAIで再現することに抵抗するハリウッドの労働組合は、自動化に対抗する方法について、将来の労働運動の先例となる（Angela Watercutter/Wired）
item.description:
Angela Watercutter / Wired:
Hollywood unions resisting AI being used to recreate actors' performances sets a precedent for future labor movements on how to push back against automation  —  The year was dominated by talk of what artificial intelligence could do—and what it could do better than most humans.

item.title: コロラド・スプリングスで30年以上親しまれてきた週刊オルタナティブ紙「コロラド・スプリングス・インディペンデント」が12月27日に無期限休刊（Olivia Prentzel/The Colorado Sun）
item.description:
Olivia Prentzel / The Colorado Sun:
The Colorado Springs Independent, a weekly alternative outlet that has served Colorado Springs for over 30 years, indefinitely ceases publication on December 27  —  For three decades, the progressive weekly provided residents in Colorado's second-largest city with an alternate source of news …

item.title: 2023年の興行動向：観客は快適さを求め、バービー、テイラー・スウィフト、スーパーマリオブラザーズ・ムービーを見に集まり、スーパーヒーロー映画はほとんどスキップした（Brooks Barnes/New York Times）
item.description:
Brooks Barnes / New York Times:
Box office trends in 2023: audiences sought comfort, flocking to see Barbie, Taylor Swift, and The Super Mario Bros. Movie, and mostly skipped superhero movies  —  Movie audiences flocked to Taylor Swift, “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer” but were cooler toward returning superheroes like the Flash, Captain Marvel and Aquaman.

item.title: アマゾンは1月29日から、プライム・ビデオの映画や番組で広告を表示する予定で、顧客が月額2.99ドルを追加で支払うことで広告を表示しないようにするオプションも用意する（Chris Welch/The Verge）
item.description:
Chris Welch / The Verge:
Amazon plans to start showing ads in movies and shows on Prime Video from January 29, with an option for customers to pay an extra $2.99 per month to avoid them  —  Earlier this year, Amazon announced plans to start incorporating ads into movies and TV shows streamed from its Prime Video service …

item.title: 警察記者をNY市警本部から追い出すというNY市の計画に、主要報道機関が苦情の書簡に署名、NY市はより多くの報道機関が警察を取材できるようになるとしている（Erin Nolan/New York Times）。
item.description:
Erin Nolan / New York Times:
Major outlets sign a letter complaining about NYC's plan to move police reporters out of NYPD HQ; NYC says the move would allow more outlets to cover the police  —  Mayor Eric Adams said that the move would allow more outlets to cover the police, but critics said it was another blow to transparency.
